question: 生地
sourceMnemonic: <kanji>Life</kanji> that comes out of the <kanji>earth</kanji> is made up of different kinds of <vocabulary>material</vocabulary>s. Sometimes it's <vocabulary>cloth</vocabulary>, sometimes it's <vocabulary>dough</vocabulary>, but everything has to be made out of something.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This word uses a new kun'yomi reading for <ja>生</ja> and a new on'yomi reading for <ja>地</ja>. You haven't learned either of these readings yet, sorry! Here's some mnemonics to help you:

If you want the best <vocabulary>material</vocabulary> to make clothes or pies out of, the <reading>key</reading> (<ja>き</ja>)is asking <reading>Je</reading>sus (<ja>じ</ja>)! He knows everything, including where to find the materials for whatever weird thing you're making. Just remember: Who's the key? Jesus!
